course_title: Creating New Works: Politics and Identity
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 10 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as MUS 370 5)
Creating New Works: Politics and Identity will introduce students to various individual and collaborative strategies for making original theater projects that tackle issues of identity, politics, and equity. Over the course of the semester, students will practice these techniques during in-class and outside rehearsals, with the long-term goal of workshopping their own identity-driven theatrical works from research to early performance.
course_description: Prerequisites: 200-level theater class or permission of instructor. A workshop for the creation of new works by actors, designers, directors, and writers. Projects may include performances created from improvisation, adaptations of fiction or nonfiction, experimentation with classics, and self-scripted monologues.
